item.title: Protagoras & Logos
item.description: If Platonic philosophy had a villain, it would be Protagoras, of which Plato himself was influenced as an example of what *not* to follow. Plato is the one who gave rise to the idea of *Logos*, the absolute truth. It’s hard to discuss Logos without first discussing the climate which gave rise to it.
